sections.1_story_intuition: Awards and Honours recognize outstanding achievements in various fields such as literature, science, sports, arts, and public service. In competitive exams, questions about major Indian and international awards, their fields, and notable recipients are common. Knowing these facts helps candidates score well in the GK section.
2_key_definitions: Award: A prize given for achievement.
Honour: Public recognition of merit or service.
Civilian Award: Award given to civilians for exceptional service.
Literary Award: Prize for excellence in literature.
Sports Award: Prize for achievement in sports.
Padma Awards: Major civilian awards in India.
Bharat Ratna: Highest civilian award in India.
3_key_facts_data_points: Bharat Ratna is India's highest civilian award.
Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan, Padma Shri are major Indian awards.
Gallantry awards: Param Vir Chakra, Ashok Chakra.
Nobel Prize started in 1901.
Rabindranath Tagore: First Asian Nobel laureate (Literature, 1913).
Sachin Tendulkar: Bharat Ratna recipient.
Arjuna Award: For outstanding sports achievement.
Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna: Highest sports honour in India.
Booker Prize: International literary award.
Oscar: Academy Award for films.
Dronacharya Award: For best sports coaches.
Jnanpith Award: Highest literary award in India.
Pulitzer Prize: American journalism and literature award.
Magsaysay Award: Asian public service award.
Grammy: International music award.
Ashok Chakra: Highest peacetime gallantry award in India.
Param Vir Chakra: Highest wartime gallantry award in India.
Bharat Ratna can be given posthumously.
Oscar for Best Picture: Top film award.
Nobel Peace Prize: For peace efforts.
4_micro_notes: Param Vir Chakra: Bravery in war.
5_exam_capsules: What is India's highest civilian award? Bharat Ratna.
Name three Padma awards. Padma Vibhushan, Padma Bhushan, Padma Shri.
Who was the first Asian Nobel laureate? Rabindranath Tagore.
Which is the highest sports honour in India? Khel Ratna.
What is the highest literary award in India? Jnanpith.
Which award is for sports coaches? Dronacharya Award.
What is the highest gallantry award in war? Param Vir Chakra.
What is the highest gallantry award in peace? Ashok Chakra.
Which award is given for films? Oscar.
Which award is given for music? Grammy.
What is the Magsaysay Award for? Public service in Asia.
What is the Pulitzer Prize for? Journalism and literature.
Can Bharat Ratna be given posthumously? Yes.
What is the Nobel Peace Prize for? Peace efforts.
Who received Bharat Ratna for sports? Sachin Tendulkar.
7_traps_confusing_points: Assuming Nobel is only for peace.
Assuming Bharat Ratna is only for Indians.

8_case_study_context.title: Bharat Ratna: India's Highest Civilian Honour
8_case_study_context.explanation: Bharat Ratna is awarded for exceptional service in any field of human endeavor. Recipients include leaders, artists, and scientists. It is a symbol of national recognition and pride.
